New Records: Pakistan's powerplay score of 28 for 2 is their lowest against Zimbabwe.
Key Match Events: Brad Evans had 11 runs to defend in the last over and conceded nine, leading Zimbabwe to win by 1 run.
Mohammad Nawaz tried to hit Evans over mid-off and was caught by Craig Ervine.
Shaheen Shah Afridi was run out by Sikandar Raza and Regis Chakabva, preventing Pakistan from forcing a Super Over.
Sikandar Raza took 3 wickets for 20 runs, including a stumping of Shan Masood.
Shan Masood and Shadab Khan put on a 50-run partnership.
Blessing Muzarabani claimed the wicket of Mohammad Rizwan and Pakistan lost both openers in the space of eight balls.
Brad Evans dismissed Babar Azam, who was caught at point.
Mohammad Wasim took a career-best haul, removing Wessly Madhevere and taking two wickets in two balls.
Haris Rauf bowled his most economical T20I spell, including 15 dot balls.
Shadab Khan took two wickets in one over, contributing to Zimbabwe losing four wickets in six balls.
Babar Azam took a one-handed catch to dismiss Regis Chakabva.
Wessly Madhevere and Craig Ervine shared a 42-run opening partnership, Zimbabwe's second-highest in T20 World Cups.
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Ervine chose to bat first to put Pakistan under pressure.
Pakistan included an extra seamer, Mohammad Wasim, and left out Asif Ali.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan are now in danger of not making it to the semi-finals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a pitch with the most bounce in Australia.
Zimbabwe's win probability reached 100% at the end of the match.
